profile.name: Venkata Sai Satish Somesula
profile.title: Mechanical Design & Reliability Engineer

bio.introduction: Results-driven Mechanical Design & Reliability Engineer with 5+ years of experience in automotive, rail, and energy sectors. Expertise in CAD/CAE (NX, Pro-E, Ansys, AutoCAD), product definition, and reliability validation. Proven record in DFMEA, failure analysis, and cost-saving design optimization, delivering multi-million-dollar savings while ensuring compliance to ASME GD&T and OCP guidelines.
bio.background: Adept at cross-functional collaboration, accelerating design cycles, and enhancing product robustness through advanced engineering practices. Expert in CAD modeling, finite element analysis, and thermal simulation using industry-standard tools like Siemens NX, Pro/ENGINEER, and ANSYS. Extensive experience in PLM systems (Teamcenter, Windchill) for comprehensive product lifecycle management.
bio.researchFocus: Specialized in reliability engineering for battery cooling systems, accelerated life-stress modeling, and validation protocols for immersion cooling systems. Demonstrated success in projecting $28M in lifecycle savings, reducing rework cycles by 15%, and cutting engineering change turnaround time by 20% through systematic DFMEA implementation and cross-functional engineering collaboration.

projects.title: Retaining Ring Analysis
projects.shortDescription: Comprehensive finite element analysis of retaining rings under displacement boundary conditions with material optimization recommendations.
projects.detailedDescription:
FEA AnalysisYielding Risk AssessmentMaterial OptimizationDesign Enhancement

Advanced structural analysis project utilizing Abaqus finite element software to evaluate retaining ring performance under various loading conditions. Conducted comprehensive stress analysis using displacement boundary conditions to simulate real-world operating scenarios. Identified critical yielding risks through detailed von Mises stress distribution analysis and displacement field evaluation. Developed material selection criteria and design modification recommendations to enhance component durability and safety margins. Applied geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T) principles to ensure manufacturable designs with optimal performance characteristics. Results provided actionable engineering insights for improved component reliability and cost-effective material utilization.

projects.title: Overhead Crane Redesign
projects.shortDescription: Complete re-engineering of overhead crane hanging end truck applying DFM/DFA principles with 10% manufacturing cost reduction.
projects.detailedDescription:
10% Cost ReductionDFM/DFA ApplicationLoad-Bearing PerformanceManufacturing Optimization

Comprehensive redesign project focusing on overhead crane hanging end truck optimization through systematic application of Design for Manufacturability (DFM) and Design for Assembly (DFA) principles. Conducted detailed analysis of existing design limitations, material usage inefficiencies, and assembly complexity issues. Implemented cost-effective design modifications while maintaining stringent load-bearing performance requirements and safety standards. Achieved significant 10% reduction in manufacturing costs through optimized material selection, simplified assembly processes, and reduced component complexity. Applied advanced CAD modeling techniques to validate design changes and ensure compatibility with existing crane infrastructure. Project demonstrated successful integration of cost optimization strategies with performance maintenance in heavy industrial equipment applications.

projects.title: Heat Pipe Simulation
projects.shortDescription: Advanced thermal modeling of heat pipe systems using ANSYS Icepak with comprehensive temperature and airflow analysis.
projects.detailedDescription:
ANSYS Icepak SimulationThermal ModelingTemperature ContoursAirflow Optimization

Advanced thermal analysis project utilizing ANSYS Icepak to model heat pipe thermal behavior through sophisticated orthotropic cylindrical block simulation methodology. Developed comprehensive thermal models incorporating realistic material properties, boundary conditions, and heat transfer mechanisms. Generated detailed temperature contour maps and airflow velocity vector fields around fan-heat sink assembly configurations to validate thermal efficiency performance. Conducted parametric studies to optimize heat pipe orientation, working fluid selection, and fin design for maximum thermal performance. Applied computational fluid dynamics (CFD) principles to analyze convective heat transfer patterns and identify potential thermal bottlenecks. Results provided critical design validation for thermal management systems in electronics cooling applications, enabling improved product reliability and performance optimization.
